Create geometries from data frames

Source: R/geo-tbl.R
unite_xy.Rd

Create geometries from data frames

unite_xy(data, col, x, y, remove = TRUE)

separate_xy(data, col, into = c("x", "y"), remove = TRUE)

Arguments

data

A tibble::tibble() or data frame
col

A column name for the geo_xy() object
x, y

Column specifications for x and y coordinate columns, respectively. Use dplyr::select() syntax.
remove

Use remove = FALSE to keep x and y as columns in the output.
into

Column names for the x and y coordinates, respectively.

Value

data, with a new column col

Examples

tbl <- tibble(x = 1, y = 2)
unite_xy(tbl, "xy", x, y, remove = FALSE)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>      xy     x     y
#>    <xy> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 (1 2)     1     2

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
